instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A orange light no boot?
threads.message:
Hey all,

i got this MBP 15".

History: had some milk spill. fortunately didnt go through keyboard. All WDI are intact and looks like it hasnt made any contact with the board except around battery connector.

SO FAR: under inspection of microscope everything looks super clean except one cap next to battery which I replace from a different board. still no power. despite being so clean i still ran through the ultrasonic.

Any suggestions?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A orange light no boot?
threads.message:
actually my bad its green light.
edit:even better no more light.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A orange light no boot?
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A orange light no boot?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 30128"]PPBUS voltage? 3V42 present?[/QUOTE]

hey dukefawks thanks for your reply.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> has 12.67v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> has 3.42v

thank you for your help

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A orange light no boot?
threads.message: You using a REAL 85W charger to power this?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A orange light no boot?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 30204"]You using a REAL 85W charger to power this?[/QUOTE]

Original charger. 85W.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A orange light no boot?
threads.message: So is there a green and then orange light present now? PPBUS at 12.6V means SMC is running so make sure the magsafe board is good if there is no orange light.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A orange light no boot?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 30265"]So is there a green and then orange light present now? PPBUS at 12.6V means SMC is running so make sure the magsafe board is good if there is no orange light.[/QUOTE]

changed magsafe board now booting.
thanks for your help
